time_complexity: O(n),
space_complexity: O(1),
explanation: The time complexity is O(n) because the function iterates from 1 to n once, performing a constant amount of work within each iteration. Therefore, the runtime grows linearly with input size 'n'. Space complexity is O(1) since no additional space that scales with 'n' is used; only fixed variables (num and result), regardless of the value for which factorial needs to be calculated are involved in memory allocation during execution time.
